articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Ministry of Industry and Commerce of Vietnam led by Minister Vu Huy Hoang who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Minister of Industry and Commerce of Vietnam
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Minister of Industry and Commerce of Vietnam
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the visiting minister of Industry and Commerce of Vietnam.
					 The gift was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, by Vu Huy Hoang, minister of Industry and Commerce of Vietnam who is heading a delegation of the ministry, on Friday.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Industry and Commerce of Vietnam led by Minister Vu Huy Hoang left here for home on Friday.

articles.title: Spokesman for History Society of DPRK Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Distorting History
articles.content:
Spokesman for History Society of DPRK Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Distorting History
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- During her recent foreign trip, the south Korean chief executive attended a ceremony of reopening the building of the "Korean Provisional Government in Shanghai" at which she talked nonsense that "there started the legal tradition of south Korea," "it was the base of diverse independent struggles" and "it gave the Korean nation hope for regaining the sovereignty."
					 In this regard a spokesman for the History Society of the DPRK in a statement Friday said that pro-American and pro-Japanese south Korean authorities' visit to the old building of the "provisional government" organized by participants of the movement for independence from the Japanese rule was utterly unfit for them. What stunned the Koreans all the more was the south Korean authorities' wicked and impudent behavior of embellishing their treacherous nature, openly distorting the past history, it noted, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean regime has neither qualifications nor face to talk about the legal tradition of the "provisional government in Shanghai."
					
					 After illegally occupying south Korea after the liberation of Korea on August 15, the U.S. enforced "military administration," thoroughly eliminating the forces for the independence movement including the figures of the "provisional government in Shanghai" and establishing a separate "government" made up of hand-raised Syngman Rhee and pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese lackeys.
					
					 Under the U.S. backstage wire-pulling traitor Syngman Rhee orchestrated the assassination of Kim Ku, former prime minister of the "Korean Provisional Government in Shanghai", in daylight in the wake of politically-motivated suppression of him for the mere reason that he called for national independence and alliance with communism and cooperation. It was none other than the south Korean regimes, successors to the Syngman Rhee regime, which connived and protected assassin of Kim for decades.
					
					  They, also referring to the "Korean Provisional Government in Shanghai", talked about a key role played for "raising hope for regaining sovereignty" and a "base for struggle for independence", a sheer fabrication distorting historical facts.
					
					 It is a well-known fact that since its establishment in Shanghai, China in April 1919 till its disbandment in August 1945 the "Korean Provisional Government in Shanghai" barely kept its existence under the care of the Chiang Kai-shek-led Nationalist Party.
					
					 The army of the Nationalist Party also held the right of command over the "Liberation Corps" that was formed by the "Provisional Government" in Chongqing, China in September 1940.
					
					 The Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by President Kim Il Sung won the historical victory of Korea's liberation through hard-fought heroic struggle against the one million-strong Kwantung Army of the Japanese imperialists in the area of Korea and in the northeastern part of China. Later many armed units of Korea fought bloody battles during the civil war in China for defeating troops of Chiang Kai-shek and rendered material and moral support to the Chinese people, greatly contributing to their final victory.
					
					 These stark facts were proved by those witnesses who took part in the anti-Japanese war and even by Japan which enforced harsh colonial rule over the Korean nation.
					
					 Whoever willing to talk about independence movement of the Korean nation had better have relevant common sense and if one is not in a position to do that, one had better keep silent.
					
					 If the south Korean regime has "authenticity", that is its hereditary sycophancy by which it sold out the dignity and interests of the nation to outsiders for the sake of its own wealth and luxury.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities try to justify their traitorous nature and elicit "support" from others by daring distort the historical fact of Korea's liberation that was won at the cost of blood shed by Koreans, they will meet only derision and censure. They should clearly understand that such behavior is little short of adding to the indelible crimes they already committed against the fellow countrymen and posterity.

articles.title: Greetings to Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Mauritania
articles.content:
Greetings to Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Mauritania
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong on Sept. 10 sent a congratulatory message to Hamadi Ould Meimou upon his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Mauritania.
					 The message expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing him success in his new job.

articles.title: Japan's Kyodo News Delegation Visits Pyongyang Home for Aged
articles.content:
Japan's Kyodo News Delegation Visits Pyongyang Home for Aged
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Kyodo News headed by President Masaki Fukuyama, visited the Pyongyang Home for the Aged on Friday.
					 Members of the delegation went round various places of the home which has been built as a cradle for the aged on the picturesque bank of the Taedong River.
					
					 Earlier, the delegation visited Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies.

articles.title: Construction of Stockbreeding Base Progresses Apace
articles.content:
Construction of Stockbreeding Base Progresses Apace
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The construction of large-sized stockbreeding base in Sepho area has been rapidly pushed forward in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The base is being built on a vast table land covering some parts of Sepho, Phyonggang and Ichon Counties in Kangwon Province.
					
					 Tens of thousands of grass fields have been created until now.
					
					 In July and August alone, over 4 500 hectares of grassland had been mowed, yielding at least 56 000 tons of pasturage.
					
					 More than 900 dwelling houses, stables and public buildings were completed by late August.
					
					 Among them are the Sepho Zootechny Institute, Anti-epizootic Center, Sepho Hotel, the Songsan Railway Station, Songsan Senior Secondary School and Songsan Health Complex.
					
					 The general production control room and its branch offices took their shapes, thus making it possible to manage the stockbreeding base on a scientific basis.
					
					 Meet-processing and fodder-processing factories with large capacity are now under construction together with clinics, schools and hostels.

articles.title: National Fish Cooking Competition Held
articles.content:
National Fish Cooking Competition Held
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- A national fish cooking competition recently took place in the DPRK.
					 The competition was held divided into three regional competitions, Pyongyang City and the west and the east of the country.
					
					 Presented at the competitions were different fish dishes retaining local characters.
					
					 Typical of them were juiced eel fry, steamed oyster-sauced sturgeon, steamed wine-spiced snakehead and steamed perilla leaf-wrapped rainbow trout.
					
					 Certificates and medals were awarded to successful units and cooks.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Heightening Vigilance against Anti-reunification Forces
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Heightening Vigilance against Anti-reunification Forces 
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- After the serious danger of war on the Korean Peninsula was defused as a result of the north-south high-level urgent contact and the publication of the joint press release, high-ranking officials of the U.S. talked about the "north's missile provocation", chilling the atmosphere of improving the north-south relations and inciting confrontation between them.
					 An article of Rodong Sinmun Friday says the situation requires heightening vigilance against the dishonest forces at home and abroad inciting distrust and confrontation between the north and the south and giving momentum to the trend of detente that was gained with much effort.
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 It is high time that the north and the south authorities got well aware of their responsibilities before the times and the nation, put the situation under good control and gave momentum to the good atmosphere of improving the relations.
					
					 It is as clear as noon day that the reconciliation process between the north and the south might face an obstacle from its beginning unless the U.S. moves for disrupting the north-south ties are checked.
					
					 The history of the north-south relations proves that reaching an agreement on defusing tension and improving the relations is important but more important is to sincerely honor the agreement without dancing to other's tunes.
					
					 The article stresses that the Korean nation will never allow the north-south relations go back toward confrontation and the tension escalate on the Korean Peninsula again due to the moves of the dishonest forces.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Roll Back Security Bills
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Roll Back Security Bills
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- It has been disclosed that Japan had already worked out internal data on operation of a new unit of the "Self-Defense Forces" on the premise of adoption of security bills.
					 It was reported that the order was issued by the minister of Defense and it was carried out by the joint chiefs of staff responsible for all operations of the Ground, Maritime and Air "Self-Defense Forces".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary says in this regard:
					
					 The Ministry of Defense concluded in advance that the security bills would become a law before they pass through both houses, and worked out internal data on new operation tasks of the SDF related to them, something rare to be seen in Japan's history after its defeat in the war.
					
					 Former politicians, opposition parties and broad segments of people in Japan have denounced the bills as ones for war since the government decided on the bills.
					
					 The Japanese reactionary ruling quarters should pay heed to the angry voices of people from all walks of life.
					
					 Justice and truth do not belong to a handful of ruling quarters keen to realize their militarist design but to the broad masses of people including the mothers not wishing their children to become cannon fodder for reinvasion and young people hoping to bring into bloom their dreams in a peaceful environment free from war.
					
					 People's mindset represents the will of Heaven.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are rushing headlong into militarization and overseas expansion, going against the people's mindset, an act of precipitating their self-ruin.
					
					 If they truly want to make an international contribution to global peace and security, they should retract the security bills at once. If they think about the defense of Japan, they should immediately stop their moves for militarization.

articles.title: Japan's Ambition for Reinvasion Is Daydream: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japan's Ambition for Reinvasion Is Daydream: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The Ground "Self-Defense Force" of Japan recently staged a large-scale live shell firing drill under the simulated conditions of an attack on a remote island and opened it to media. It was followed by a large-scale landing drill staged by the "Self-Defense Forces" together with 3 000 U.S. troops in California State. 
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Friday says:
					
					 The reckless provocative military moves of Japan at a time when peace-loving attitude and stand are required more urgently than ever before are an open challenge to the demand of the international community.
					
					 If Japan launches reinvasion overseas as it did in the past, it can never escape final ruin. That is why all Japanese people are strongly opposing and censuring the war policy of their government.
					
					 Nevertheless, the Japanese reactionaries were busy staging the above-said drills, self-exposing that they are seized with the wild ambition for reviving militarism, blinded by their design to seek revenge for their past defeat. 
					
					 The disaster that had been inflicted upon the Asian people by Japan in the past should never be allowed to repeat itself.
					
					 The Korean people suffered more from Japan's policy of overseas invasion than any other nations in the past. The DPRK will pay due attention to bolstering up its capability for self-defence in order not to allow the repetition of the painful past.
					
					 Japan should stop at once its moves for emerging a military giant and launching militarist overseas expansion, bearing in mind that its scenario for reinvasion is no more than a daydream.

articles.title: Juvenile Drug-related Crimes Rampant in S. Korea
articles.content:
Juvenile Drug-related Crimes Rampant in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Juvenile drug-related crimes are unabated in south Korea, according to the south Korean internet paper Newsis.
					 200 odd youngsters have been uncovered while being involved in the crimes from 2012 to July this year.
					
					 This year's young arrestees numbered 65. More than 16 260 drug-related criminals were disclosed across south Korea in the same period.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Warmongers Flailed for Planning to Re-stage Inchon Landing Operation
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Warmongers Flailed for Planning to Re-stage Inchon Landing Operation 
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The military warmongers of the U.S. and south Korea are going to stage the farce of the Inchon landing operation that was waged during the last Korean war, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 They are mulling staging a farce of commemorating the landing operation on Wolmi Islet and at the Inchon coastal defence command from Sept. 12 and then a landing operation reminiscent of the day in waters off the islet on Sept. 15. 
					
					 They are going to make naval attack, supported by firepower support from the sea and the air with huge  offensive forces including warships, planes, landing armored cars, special warfare troops and assault commandoes of the marines of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces and the south Korean army involved.
					
					 The operation is a serious challenge to the desire of the Koreans and the world people for peaceful reunification as it is planned at a time when the situation on the Korean Peninsula shows the sign of detente and the atmosphere of reconciliation and cooperation is growing stronger than ever before.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Struggle for Right to Existence
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Struggle for Right to Existence
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Strikes of workers to achieve the right to existence are under way in various parts of south Korea, according to the south Korean internet paper Oh My News and CBS.
					 The Trade Union of the Hyundai Heavy Industry Co. Ltd. waged a strike after closing the doors of workshops in protest against the company side's moves for freezing their wages on August 26 and September 4 and 9.
					
					 It declared that it would continue to strike till September 17.
					
					 And many trade unions joined in the strike.
					
					 The paper said that the "government" and the ruling party are defending the financial tycoons, adding that the strikes of workers would grow stronger.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities Censured for Suppressing Chongryon and Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities Censured for Suppressing Chongryon and Koreans in Japan
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on Sept. 10 denouncing the Japanese reactionaries for their despicable and brutal suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Koreans in Japan.
					 The Japanese authorities hurled many gangsters into fascist action against the Chongryon organization in Hokkaido and Koreans in Japan under the pretext of "fraud case", an unpardonable provocation and hideous crime against the DPRK and Chongryon, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 It is also a revelation of their intention to tarnish the image of Chongryon and seek a pretext for cracking down on it.
					
					 With no lies and fabrications can the Japanese authorities block the righteous and patriotic activities of Chongryon.
					
					 If they truly want improved relations between the DPRK and Japan, they should stop at once the reckless politically-motivated suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan and human rights abuses against them and immediately set free the unreasonably arrested Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website by Polish Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website by Polish Organization
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Juche-Oriented Socialist State with Invincible Might" was posted by the Polish Branch of the Korean Friendship Association on its website on September 5.
					 The work, published on September 5, Juche 97 (2008), clarifies in detail that the invincible might of the DPRK lies in preserving and glorifying forever the Juche-oriented idea of President Kim Il Sung on nation-building and his exploits.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- There took place round-table talks and lectures in Iran, Angola and Uganda from September 2 to 5 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Al Hadi Islam Propaganda Organization of Iran said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung was the great leader of the Korean people who liberated the country which was groaning under the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists and founded the DPRK and an ever-victorious iron-willed brilliant commander who defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation.
					
					 He was the father of people who always mixed with them and devoted himself to the prosperity of the country and their happiness.
					
					 The director of the special project room of the Presidency in Angola said that the noble lives and exploits of the President and leader Kim Jong Il who devoted their all to the cause of global independence would always remain shining.
					
					 The chairman of the Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement and other speakers praised the President and Kim Jong Il for building the DPRK into the most powerful socialist state in the world.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Lauded by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Lauded by Foreign Figures
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) ? Figures of Bangladesh and Myanmar issued statements on Sep. 1 and 5 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, said that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il founded the DPRK, a genuine sovereign and independent state in which the popular masses became the masters of the country, and turned it into a socialist power in which the Juche idea is thoroughly embodied in all fields, adding that these exploits would remain shining forever.
					
					 Maung Maung Naying, general manager of the Mit Tamor Publishing House of Myanmar, said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il built the DPRK into a politico-ideological power and military power with unbreakable unity and cohesion and powerful defense capabilities.
					
					 They also laid a firm foundation of self-supporting national economy to help the Korean people enjoy eternal happiness in a socialist paradise.
					
					 Their revolutionary idea and exploits are being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the Korean people.

articles.title: 45th Anniversary of Formation of Finland-Korea Society Marked
articles.content:
45th Anniversary of Formation of Finland-Korea Society Marked
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- An event took place in Helsinki on Sept. 5 to mark the 45th anniversary of the formation of the Finland-Korea Society.
					 Present there were figures of the society, the Finnish Communists' League and the Paektu Association of Finland and other masses. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were personages of the organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people in Europe including Sweden, Denmark, France and Poland, the chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, staff members of the DPRK embassy in Stockholm and members of a delegation of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries.
					
					 Pekka Leppanen, honorary chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, was awarded Order of DPRK Friendship 2nd Class there.
					
					 He expressed his determination to intensify the activities of the society in the future, too, saying he felt proud of having worked for the development of the friendly relations between the two countries in the past.

articles.title: DPRK Birthday Observed in Indonesia, Nigeria
articles.content:
DPRK Birthday Observed in Indonesia, Nigeria
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Film shows were arranged by companies of Indonesia and Nigeria from Sept. 3 to 5 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 The participants watched Korean films "Kimilsungia", "Masikryong Ski Resort" and "My Country Has Emerged Victorious by Dint of Single-minded Unity".

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de Vietnam
articles.content:
Spokesman for History Society of DPRK Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Distorting History
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- During her recent foreign trip, the south Korean chief executive attended a ceremony of reopening the building of the "Korean Provisional Government in Shanghai" at which she talked nonsense that "there started the legal tradition of south Korea," "it was the base of diverse independent struggles" and "it gave the Korean nation hope for regaining the sovereignty."
					 In this regard a spokesman for the History Society of the DPRK in a statement Friday said that pro-American and pro-Japanese south Korean authorities' visit to the old building of the "provisional government" organized by participants of the movement for independence from the Japanese rule was utterly unfit for them. What stunned the Koreans all the more was the south Korean authorities' wicked and impudent behavior of embellishing their treacherous nature, openly distorting the past history, it noted, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean regime has neither qualifications nor face to talk about the legal tradition of the "provisional government in Shanghai."
					
					 After illegally occupying south Korea after the liberation of Korea on August 15, the U.S. enforced "military administration," thoroughly eliminating the forces for the independence movement including the figures of the "provisional government in Shanghai" and establishing a separate "government" made up of hand-raised Syngman Rhee and pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese lackeys.
					
					 Under the U.S. backstage wire-pulling traitor Syngman Rhee orchestrated the assassination of Kim Ku, former prime minister of the "Korean Provisional Government in Shanghai", in daylight in the wake of politically-motivated suppression of him for the mere reason that he called for national independence and alliance with communism and cooperation. It was none other than the south Korean regimes, successors to the Syngman Rhee regime, which connived and protected assassin of Kim for decades.
					
					  They, also referring to the "Korean Provisional Government in Shanghai", talked about a key role played for "raising hope for regaining sovereignty" and a "base for struggle for independence", a sheer fabrication distorting historical facts.
					
					 It is a well-known fact that since its establishment in Shanghai, China in April 1919 till its disbandment in August 1945 the "Korean Provisional Government in Shanghai" barely kept its existence under the care of the Chiang Kai-shek-led Nationalist Party.
					
					 The army of the Nationalist Party also held the right of command over the "Liberation Corps" that was formed by the "Provisional Government" in Chongqing, China in September 1940.
					
					 The Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by President Kim Il Sung won the historical victory of Korea's liberation through hard-fought heroic struggle against the one million-strong Kwantung Army of the Japanese imperialists in the area of Korea and in the northeastern part of China. Later many armed units of Korea fought bloody battles during the civil war in China for defeating troops of Chiang Kai-shek and rendered material and moral support to the Chinese people, greatly contributing to their final victory.
					
					 These stark facts were proved by those witnesses who took part in the anti-Japanese war and even by Japan which enforced harsh colonial rule over the Korean nation.
					
					 Whoever willing to talk about independence movement of the Korean nation had better have relevant common sense and if one is not in a position to do that, one had better keep silent.
					
					 If the south Korean regime has "authenticity", that is its hereditary sycophancy by which it sold out the dignity and interests of the nation to outsiders for the sake of its own wealth and luxury.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities try to justify their traitorous nature and elicit "support" from others by daring distort the historical fact of Korea's liberation that was won at the cost of blood shed by Koreans, they will meet only derision and censure. They should clearly understand that such behavior is little short of adding to the indelible crimes they already committed against the fellow countrymen and posterity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe regalo de ministro de Industria y Comercio de Vietnam
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe regalo de ministro de Industria y Comercio de Vietnam
Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibio presente que le dirigiera el ministro de Industria y Comercio de la Republica Socialista de Vietnam, Vu Huy Hoang, quien preside la delegacion de su cartera de visita en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					  Vu Huy Hoang lo entrego el dia 11 al presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam.
